events.title: Iran operating in altered 'strategic environment' amid domestic unrest and intense US pressure
events.description: Jean-Emile Jammine is pleased to welcome Dr Burcu Ozcelik, Senior Research Fellow for Middle East Security at RUSI. The landscape in the Middle East has vastly changed since the 12-day war. Dr Ozcelik sees a strategic misreading at play on the part of Iran failing to grasp the recalibrated thresholds domestically, regionally and across the globe. And now the US is willing to apply a maximalist pressure strategy involving military, economic, and diplomatic levers to extract more than mere nuclear compliance.

events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.title: Protesters chant ‚Äòwe have the right to demonstrate‚Äô at rally outside Sydney police station ‚Äì as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Woman, 69, in hospital with four broken vertebrae after interaction with police at Sydney Herzog protest Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The NSW premier, Chris Minns , is making the first of multiple appearances across the media this morning following the violent clashes between police and protesters yesterday evening. He has told Channel Nine‚Äôs Today program that police were ‚Äúput in an impossible situation last night‚Äù: It‚Äôs worth remembering they did everything possible to avoid that confrontation, starting last week when they begged protest organisers to have it in Hyde Park, where it was safe and a march could take place. I know that some of the scenes on media are short clips, but people have to understand the circumstances where protesters breached police lines and ran amuck in Sydney would have been devastating. No. She‚Äôs wrong. I‚Äôm not going to throw police under the bus this morning. This is a situation that‚Äôs incredibly combustible. And the circumstances that weren‚Äôt shown on the news this morning or on TV last night because is what would have happened if protesters breached police lines ... It would have dangerous ‚Ä¶ as difficult as the scenes were to watch, it would have been infinitely worse if NSW police didn‚Äôt do their job last night. I think the - the protest organisers, when both the police and the courts said to them, yes, you can protest, but you can either do it in a stationary way here in Town Hall, if you want to march, you can march through a different part of the city, should have heeded that advice. But of course, some of the videos that we‚Äôve seen have been very concerning. And I expect they‚Äôll be investigated. Continue reading...

events.ticker_label: üí• US seizes sanctioned oil tanker in Indian Ocean

events.title: MSC braces for more of Trump's 'wrecking-ball politics'
events.description: Chairman Wolfgang Ischinger tells DW the 2026 Munich Security Conference comes when "obviously, trust has been damaged" by President Trump. But he also says US calls for a more "self-reliant" Europe are fair and overdue.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell avoids questions in House deposition
events.description: Maxwell chose to invoke the Fifth Amendment and stay silent in order to not incriminate herself. Democrats say Maxwell, an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, will not cooperate because she wants a pardon from Trump.

events.title: Thailand: What's next after PM Anutin's big election win?
events.description: PM Anutin's Bhumjaithai party has defied expectations and won the most seats in the general election. The reformist People's Party struggled to define itself against the incumbents.
events.ticker_label: üí• Thailand: What's next after PM Anutin's big election win?

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein case: Ghislaine Maxwell declines to answer questions in House deposition
events.description: Ghislaine #Maxwell invoked her Fifth Amendment right and refused to answer questions at a #US House deposition. Convicted in 2021 in the #Epstein case, she is serving a 20-year sentence as new #DOJ documents bring the case back into focus.

events.title: 'Bonaly flip': Olympic skating backflip sparks tributes to French trailblazer
events.description: US figure skater Ilia Malinin's gold-medal-clinching backflip at the Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina has prompted a flurry of tributes to France's Surya Bonaly, who became the first skater to land the daring flip on one skate at the Nagano Games almost three decades ago ‚Äì when the move was still forbidden.

events.title: 2026 Olympics: No medals for France so far, Cizeron and Fournier Beaudry in the lead
events.description: There were no French medals on Monday, February 9 at the Winter Olympics. However, Valentin Foubert came close to achieving a remarkable feat in ski jumping. Meanwhile, French ice dancers Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry surged to a surprise lead in the figure skating competition.

events.title: US forces board sanctioned tanker after globe-spanning pursuit
events.description: US military forces have boarded a sanctioned oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking it from the Caribbean, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday, marking a major escalation in the Trump administration‚Äôs campaign to enforce an oil quarantine on Venezuela and seize vessels accused of evading sanctions.

events.title: Have a baby while you still can, France to tell 29-year-olds
events.description: All 29-year-old French citizens are to be encouraged by their government to have babies while they still can.

events.title: Irish man detained for months in 'concentration camp' by ICE
events.description: An Irishman who has been detained by ICE for five months has described the facilities as "like a modern-day concentration camp".

events.title: Social media goes on trial in LA - here's what you need to know
events.description: Social media is on trial in Los Angeles. What happens next could change the way they operate.

events.title: South Korea will boost medical school admissions to tackle physician shortage
events.description: South Korea plans to increase medical school admissions by over 3,340 students from 2027 to 2031 to address physician shortages

events.title: Fatwas, faith and fallacies: Myth-busting female genital mutilation in Africa
events.description: Olivia Albert, 19, was subjected to female genital (FGM) mutilation when she was 14. She told the UN sexual and reproductive health agency (UNFPA) that she hid her pain because everyone around her said it was normal.

events.title: Minnesota woman sentenced to prison for $325K SNAP fraud scheme
events.description: A Minnesota woman was sentenced to prison for $325,000 SNAP fraud scheme involving fake identities and pregnancy claims to steal government benefits illegally.

events.title: Nancy Guthrie's church prays God would 'guide the authorities' in search

events.title: Iran's Khamenei stays away from talks as JD Vance says dynamic makes diplomacy 'much more complicated'
